byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

abstract: Bank tellers and managers, who typically earn low pay and have access to customer information and funds, may present growing fraud risk; experts say tellers' diminished role at increasingly large and automated banks adds to problem; threat posed by tellers upends focus on outside identity theft and cyberattacks as main source of concern.
lead_paragraph: Though cybertheft gets most of the publicity, retail-branch employees are tapping into customers’ personal information and their cash.

headline.main: Bank Tellers, With Access to Accounts, Pose a Rising Security Risk
headline.print_headline: Bank Tellers, With Low Pay and High Access, Pose a Rising Security Risk

snippet: Though cybertheft gets most of the publicity, retail-branch employees are tapping into customers’ personal information and their cash.
